channel.title: Encapsulation :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: The first criteria that Alan Kay set for an object-oriented language was encapsulation. In computer science, the term encapsulation refers to organizing code into units. This provides a mechanism for organizing complex software. A second related idea is information hiding, which provides mechanisms for controlling access to encapsulated data and how it can be changed. Think back to the FORTRAN EPIC model we introduced earlier. All of the variables in that program were declared globally, and there were thousands.
